ferns.name: soft shield fern
ferns.care: Garden care:  Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould, composted pine needles or garden compost into the planting hole.Remove dead foliage in spring.

ferns.name: soft shield fern (syn. Plumosum Densum)
ferns.care: Garden care:  Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould, composted pine needles or garden compost into the planting hole.

ferns.name: Japanese tassel fern
ferns.care: Garden care:  Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould, composted pine needles or garden compost into the planting hole

ferns.name: hard fern , deer fern
ferns.care: Garden care: Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould, composted pine needles or garden compost into the planting hole.

ferns.name: Aleutian maidenhair 'Imbricatum'
ferns.care: Garden care:  Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould, composted pine needles or garden compost into the planting hole.Remove dead foliage in spring.

ferns.name: ostrich fern
ferns.soil: Soil:  humus-rich, moist but well-drained, neutral to slightly acid soil
ferns.care: Garden care: Remove dead fronds in early spring.  Lift and divide large colonies in spring.

ferns.name: royal fern
ferns.soil: Soil:  moist, fertile, humus-rich, preferably acid soil
ferns.care: Garden care: Lift and divide congested colonies in autumn or early spring.

ferns.name: hard fern , deer fern
ferns.care: Garden care:  It will usually require some winter   protection for the first few years. Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould or garden compost into the planting hole. Keep well watered during the growing season.

ferns.name: alpine water fern
ferns.care: Garden care: Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould or garden compost into the planting hole. Keep well watered during the growing season.

ferns.name: eared lady fern
ferns.care: Garden care:  Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould, composted pine needles or garden compost into the planting hole.Remove dead foliage in spring.

ferns.name: common polypody
ferns.position: Position: full sun or dappled shade
ferns.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, humus-rich, gritty or stony, well-drained soil
ferns.care: Garden care: Wrap the rhizomes in moss and tie to a suitable rooting medium and keep moist until established. Shelter from cold, drying winds.

ferns.name: common polypody
ferns.position: Position: full sun or dappled shade
ferns.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, humus-rich, gritty or stony, well-drained soil
ferns.care: Garden care: This easy plant can also be grown  epiphytically in bright filtered light. Wrap the rhizomes in moss and tie to a suitable rooting medium and keep moist until established. Shelter from cold, drying winds.

ferns.name: sensitive fern
ferns.soil: Soil: moist, fertile, humus-rich, preferably acid soil
ferns.growth: Rate of growth:  average to fast-growing
ferns.care: Garden care: Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould or composted pine needles when planting. Ensure that the compost or soil is kept moist - water during dry spells.

ferns.name: common rasp-fern
ferns.position: Position: partial shade to full shade
ferns.soil: Soil: moist, but well-drained humus-rich soil
ferns.care: Garden care: Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould or garden compost into the planting hole. Cut back decayed fronds in winter to allow new growth to emerge.

ferns.name: alpine wood fern
ferns.care: Garden care: Incorporate lots of well rotted leaf mould, composted pine needles of garden compost into the planting hole.  Cut back dead fronds in winter

ferns.name: lady fern
ferns.soil: Soil: moist, fertile, neutral to acid soil
ferns.care: Garden care: Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould, composted pine needles or garden compost into the planting hole. In cold areas in late autumn protect the crown of the plant with a dry mulch of straw or bracken.

ferns.name: variegated bamboo fern
ferns.soil: Soil:  moist but freely draining,fertile, neutral to acidic soil
ferns.care: Garden care: Provide shelter from cold, drying winds and protect from excessively low temperaturs or hard frosts.

ferns.name: lady in red fern
ferns.soil: Soil: moist, fertile, neutral to acid soil
ferns.care: Garden care: Incorporate lots of well-rotted leaf mould, composted pine needles or garden compost into the planting hole. In cold areas in late autumn protect the crown of the plant with a dry mulch of straw or bracken. It can take a 2-3 years  for these ferns to mature and develop the striking red stems.

ferns.name: giant chain fern
ferns.soil: Soil: moderately fertile, damp soil with a neutral to acidic pH
ferns.care: Garden care: Water regularly during the growing season, ensuring that the soil or compost does not dry out while the plant is getting established. Shelter from cold, drying winds and apply a generous layer of protective mulch in autumn. Remove any tatty or damaged fronds in early spring before the new growth emerges.
